results.headline: Review: In ‘Furious 7,’ a Franchise Continues to Roar
results.summary_short: Lots of familiar faces and speed demons are back for the latest in the franchise.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Furious 7

results.headline: Review: ‘Woman in Gold’ Stars Helen Mirren in Tug of War Over Artwork
results.summary_short: This drama based on real-life traces the legal battle by Ms. Mirren’s character to regain possession of a priceless canvas stolen from her family by the Nazis 60 years earlier.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Woman in Gold

results.headline: Review: In Hal Hartley’s ‘Ned Rifle,’ Closure for a Son and a Series
results.summary_short: The final piece of the director’s satirical trilogy centers on a teenager’s odyssey to find and kill his father.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Ned Rifle

results.headline: Review: In ‘White God,’ Man Bites Dog, Dog Bites Back
results.summary_short: Kornel Mundruczo’s movie follows a mixed-breed dog in Hungary named Hagen who is separated from his 13-year-old human owner and joins a pack.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of White God

results.headline: Review: In ‘While We’re Young,’ a Coupling of Gen X and Y
results.summary_short: In Noah Baumbach’s film, Ben Stiller and Naomi Watts play a couple in their 40s who become captivated by a younger pair who seem to freely embrace experience.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of While We're Young

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Riot Club,’ an Elite British Dining Club Excels in Debauchery
results.summary_short: A poisonous satire based on a dining club at Oxford University focuses on a group of rich students who carry snobbery and class hatred to savage extremes.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Riot Club

results.headline: Review: In ‘Cupcakes,’ an Impromptu Cellphone Video Is Noticed
results.summary_short: Eytan Fox’s dramedy sends six more or less ordinary Israelis to a Paris song competition.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Cupcakes

results.headline: Review: In ‘52 Tuesdays,’ What a Difference a Year Makes
results.summary_short: Sophie Hyde’s film uses unconventional methods to tell the story of a mother’s gender transition.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of 52 Tuesdays

results.headline: Review: ‘The Barber’ Stars Scott Glenn as a Suspected Serial Killer
results.summary_short: The film, directed by Basel Owies, finds the son of a police detective searching for a murderer that his father couldn’t convict.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Barber

results.headline: Review: ‘Man From Reno,’ a Mystery of Missing Persons and Priceless Turtles
results.summary_short: This Japanese film directed by Dave Boyle has an undercurrent of dark comedy as an oddball pair of sleuths (a mystery writer and a sheriff) investigate two disappearances.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Man From Reno

results.headline: Review: Larry Clark’s ‘Marfa Girl’ Looks at Dysfunction and Desire
results.summary_short: This is the latest exploration — and exploitation — of teenage sexuality from Mr. Clark, who has been splitting the difference between fearless honesty and leering prurience for decades.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Marfa Girl

results.headline: Review: In ‘Nightlight,’ Fun and Games in a Forest Turn Deadly
results.summary_short: In this found-footage horror film, a group of friends playing a variation on hide-and-seek encounter a malevolent spirit.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Nightlight

results.headline: Review: In ‘My Italian Secret,’ a Champion Cyclist Saves Jews From Nazis
results.summary_short: Narrated by Isabella Rossellini, this documentary tells the stories of heroic Italians, including the Tour de France winner Gino Bartali, who smuggled forged papers in his bike frame.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of My Italian Secret

results.headline: Review: ‘Home,’ With Rihanna and Jim Parsons
results.summary_short: Jim Parsons and Rihanna star in this animated film about an intergalactic friendship.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Home

results.headline: Review: ‘Get Hard,’ With Will Ferrell and Kevin Hart
results.summary_short: The comic premise of this film could hardly be simpler: Mr. Ferrell is white. Mr. Hart, in contrast, is black.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Get Hard

results.headline: Review: Bradley Cooper and Jennifer Lawrence Felling Trees in ‘Serena’
results.summary_short: Logging and love in Appalachia are mingled in this film by the Danish director Susanne Bier, shot in the Czech Republic.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Serena

results.headline: Review: ‘The Kidnapping of Michel Houellebecq’ Blurs Fiction and Reality
results.summary_short: Inspired by a real disappearance in 2011, this film is an often comically absurd story about a novelist who finds something like happiness after being abducted.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of L' enlèvement de Michel Houellebecq

results.headline: Review: ‘Please Be Normal,’ a Couple’s Dawning Desperation
results.summary_short: Sam Waterston, his daughter Elisabeth Waterston and her husband, Louis Cancelmi, star in Haik Kocharian’s drama about imminent parenthood, a move to the suburbs, detachment and control.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Please Be Normal

results.headline: Review: ‘Jauja,’ a Desperate Odyssey in the Argentine Desert
results.summary_short: In Lisandro Alonso’s film, a Danish engineer travels to the Argentine frontier with his daughter, then sets off in search of her after she runs away with a soldier.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Jauja

results.headline: Review: ‘Lost and Love’ (‘Shi Gu’) Stars Andy Lau as a Man Searching for His Lost Son
results.summary_short: Peng Sanyuan’s drama builds a personal story and a road movie around the scourge of child trafficking in China.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Lost and Love
